New Records: Corey Seager became the first shortstop with three World Series home runs.
The Texas Rangers improved to 10-0 on the road in the postseason.
Key Match Events: The Rangers scored five runs in the third inning, including Marcus Semien's three-run homer.
Corey Seager extended his postseason hitting streak to 20 games.
Pre-Game Insights: The Rangers were favorites to win the World Series with odds of -1700.
Manager Bruce Bochy was aiming for his fourth World Series title.
Post-Match Reflections: General manager Chris Young expressed empathy for injured players Adolis Garc√≠a and Max Scherzer.
The Rangers' defense struggled at a critical time in Game 4.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The World Series ratings were lower than expected, with Game 4 averaging 8.13 million viewers.
Ketel Marte had the longest hitting streak in postseason history at 20 games.
Others: The World Series schedule included Game 5 on November 1 and potential Games 6 and 7.
